item.title: The "existence" of "evil" and "suffering" as EVIDENCE of Infinite Love
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
32 minutes ago, Dylan Page said:

@Leo Gura Hitler can exist without infinite love...

No he can't. Nothing can.

The opposite of Love is impossible.

Quote

It could be the case that there is no love at all, and that the actual case is that reality is indifferent and “allows” everything, which is to say that reality doesn’t actually “allow” anything, it just is the way it is, and it makes no distinction in between good and evil at all, not just because it loves everything, but because it is just simply that way by necessity.

Haha, it sure seems that way from your POV. But in fact necessity dictates Infinite Love.

To not make a distinction between good and evil IS Infinite Love. You haven't realized that yet.

item.title: Dr. Sid Smith Lecture explaining why our Civilization is currently in Collapse
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

@SoothedByRain I would not rely on scientists to make predictions about mankind's and society's evolution. They are not qualified to speak about vision.

Yes, some of the problems will be bad, but don't underestimate our creative capacity and our capacity to adapt.

As things get worse mankind will be forced to wake up and rise to the occassion. Our biggest problem lately is that life has gotten so easy people are getting complacent. A climate crisis will force people to get seriously engaged rather than taking things for granted.

It's like with Trump. Yeah, he's a monster, but it's forcing people to take government seriously again. We got too complacent.

item.title: Ken Wilber Inteview On Jordan Peterson
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@Serotoninluv I think Ken is very advanced and doesn't really have a problem with any lines per se. I think his embodiment of Green is fine.

Obviously he is very cognitively inclined, but I wouldn't fault him for that, that's just his personality/style. Being perfectly well-rounded is not the goal.

I would just say that his understanding of American politics is somewhat naive and impractical. There is a big difference between Sprial development and making good practical political plans.

I wouldn't automatically assume Ken has the right political plans to move the country forward, even though he is clearly an amazingly well-developed human being.

Good political leadership is its own thing. I would trust Bernie more on this front.

item.title: The "existence" of "evil" and "suffering" as EVIDENCE of Infinite Love
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

This is explained in the video: What Is Love? - Part 2

Can you see that for a Hitler to exist, God would have to be unconditionally loving to allow that?

If you had a son and he wanted to become Hitler, it would take infinite love for you to allow him to follow through on that and still love him despite all the suffering and hurt you know he will cause. AND STILL you love him afterwards! That's true love. Giving someone the freedom to be whoever they want to be -- even if they want to be a mass murderer -- is true love.

Infinite Love = Infinite Freedom

A selfish person cannot allow true freedom because he's too scared that its consequences might kill him.

If God prevented the possibility of Hitler, God would become a selfish devil, which God cannot ever do because God has infinite consciousness and would never allow for anything less than Infinite Love to exist. So Infinite Love cannot exist if Hitler cannot exist.

This is all very counter-intuitive to a selfish person. Luckily God has no self, so it has no problem executing it.

item.title: Why does enlightenment have to be so hard to achieve?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
31 minutes ago, electroBeam said:

Yeah but the point I was making was, you can't do yourself into enlightenment.

Of course you can. Buddha style.

If you couldn't do yourself into enlightenment then Zen training wouldn't exist.

Don't confuse discipline and training with ego. It can be, but doesn't have to be.

Training definitely leads to enlightenment. That is the one thing all classic spiritual traditions have in common: rigorous training. Because it's the surest way to awaken. Not guaranteed, but still pretty reliable.

Quote

And in many cases doing yourself into enlightenment may impede or retard your growth. 

This is also true.

Quote

For example you spend 12 hours a day meditating because you believe meditating will give you enlightenment. Then you develop karma or attachments to your 12 hour schedule and meditation technique, and you start believing your so cool for meditating 12 hours a day and that you are better than everyone else.

Yes, this can happen, but doesn't have to.

Quote

What I was saying was enlightenment isnt just about more meditation = more enlightenment. Sometimes more meditation = less enlightenment. And what it really comes down to is being radically honest with yourself, realizing that the ego is a massive plot twisting machine (hence being radically open minded) and having the bravery to do the counter intuitive thing - which is sometimes dropping your meditation habit for a while. 

Yes, of course.

But just because that's possible doesn't mean that now people shouldn't meditate more. Most people need to meditate a lot more, not less.

Sometimes, if you get too attached to mechanical meditation, you might need to back off and just chill. But telling most people to chill is wrong advice. Most people are too chill and lazy to begin with. They need more discipline.

The average person is too undisciplined and too untrained, not overly-disciplined and over-trained. So my advice would always err on the side of discipline and training. Only for very advanced students would I suggest easing up on the training.

item.title: Where Is Leo Wrong?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
9 hours ago, DivineSoda said:

it's not a good sign that he feels the need to defend himself in this thread.

I was making important clarifications, not for my sake but to clear up confusion in the minds of readers.

Sometimes people misunderstand why I do or say certain things.

Criticize away. It is good to have feedback. I'm always looking for quality feedback, and checking for blind-spots.

See, again, this is an important clarification to make because people get the wrong idea that I'm not open to feedback or that I'm set in my ways. To hold such a view is a misunderstanding of my work. I want you guys to drill it into your minds that you should always be checking yourself for blind spots, as I do. You need the capacity to receive feedback and check your own positions.

Sometimes people get the wrong idea that I'm an absolutist simply because I speak with confidence about having become conscious of the Absolute. But I'm not an absolutist at all. It's tricky to teach these epistemic principles because people simply don't do any epistemic inquiry, so everything just devolves into beliefs and positions for them.

I don't really care about being wrong because being wrong is how I grow.

item.title: Ken Wilber Inteview On Jordan Peterson
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

@Nickyy Ken Wilber himself is pretty harsh on Green. He's written entire books about it.

I think Ken has an overly negative view of Green because he grew up in an era were Green was on the rise and that left a sour taste in his mouth.

Ken is obviously way above Green, but I think he underestimates how much of America and the world still hasn't tapped into Green almost at all. Ken seems too eager to skip over Green and get to Yellow. But 80% of the population is still confused and in denial about Green, never mind Yellow.

Ken was deeply involved in academia, where Green is very over-represented. This is JP's problem too. Because they live in an academic bubble they tend to see the excesses of Green on college campuses without realizing that college campuses are not at all an accurate representation of the general population.

Conservatives love to focus on college campus culture because it gives them an easy target to attack without addressing the real elephant in the room: much of the country is still stuck in Red, Blue, and Orange. << that is the real problem.

Trumpism is the result of lack of Green development in the general population. Trumpism discredits Ken's and JP's ranting against Green. Trumpism could not occur without a big collective Green shadow.

Yes, Green has its excesses but they pale in comparison to the excesses of Red, Blue, and Orange which we are seeing in real time with Trumpism and other nationalist movements around the globe. That is a true danger to democracy, not feminist college kids fighting to save the whales.

Ken's and JP's views of Green are way out of proportion and get the political priorities backwards.

Ken criticizes Green from above, JP criticizes Green from below.

item.title: Why does enlightenment have to be so hard to achieve?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
10 minutes ago, electroBeam said:

There's an old Jewish saying that goes along the lines of: Give me your son from the age of 0 to 7 and I'll turn him into anything.

Yes, exactly. So if you miss that crucial period, you'll never be able to compete with someone who trained.

Quote

I don't know about that, yes it is wise of him to be thinking about yoga at that age, but its not like he just randomly got enlightened one day by doing nothing, he's done over 10 000 hours.

That's my point.

But the added wrinkle is this: people who train 10,000 hours are not normal people, they must already have a rare capacity and desire to do that. Having the right desire is 80% of the key to success.

Quote

Are you saying if people on here dont do 10 000 hours they wont have at least an awakening? This work is hard but its not that impossible lol.

No, I'm saying people are all different. Some people will awaken after 10 hours of work, others will not awaken even with 10,000 hours. It depends on all the factors I mentioned above.

10 minutes ago, electroBeam said:

You seem to be projecting the blue/conservative view of "if you work hard, you will get rewarded for it" onto spirituality. This idea that work pays off linearly and simplistically.

No, that's not what I said at all. Go back and re-read all my posts in this thread. I am saying that awakening is not linear or simplistic. It depends on many factors, many of which are not in your direct control.

But since the only thing you can really control is how much time and effort you put it, in practice, that is the most important factor. You can't change your genetics, past lives, early childhood, etc.

There is also a huge difference between merely awakening vs mastery. Any fool can awaken through some luck. Mastery is never accidental and requires thousands of hours of practice. Mastery is 100x rarer than awakening. Talent is important but not sufficient for mastery. For mastery to happen, everything has to align AND you have to work your ass off for years. Which is why it's so rare.

item.title: Spiral Dynamics Stage Turquoise Examples Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
5 hours ago, tenta said:

People who you'd think would embody green, yellow or turquoise values just end up being extremely delusional narcissists with some values much closer to stage blue or red

It's just a difference of perspective. Doesn't mean they are Blue or Red.

People at Yellow and Turquoise can still have disagreements.

Clearly they disagreed with my embellishments of Spiral Dynamics. But from my POV, I never care about staying true to any one model or system, I care about improving on them.

item.title: Why does enlightenment have to be so hard to achieve?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
11 minutes ago, Serotoninluv said:

Yet the first time the 7 footer steps on a basketball court he is a natural. He makes more progress on the basketball court in one month than he did 10 years on a horse. . . As well, a 5 foot person spends years of frustration on the basketball court then realizes his natural ability the first time he saddles up on a horse. . .

We need to invent a new national sport which only midgets excel at. Then the basketball players will know how it feels like

Let's make a basketball court with a 5 foot tall ceiling. Then let's see how well Michael Jordan and Shaq do

Quote

Yet could a person with special predispositions to psychedelics reach Sadhguru's level of meditation mastery with psychedelics?

As a peak state you might even be able to surpass him. But that is not mastery.

Almost anyone can shoot a crazy hole-in-one in golf, but that doesn't make you Tiger Woods. Tiger Woods has mastery.

Quote

And what about Sadhguru? He has supernatural meditation abilities. If he tried to master psychedelics could he be like a 7 foot basketball player trying to be a horse jockey?

He probably doesn't need psychedelics.

That's like giving testosterone to someone who's already got too much of it.

in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
54 minutes ago, abundance said:

True. However, both of those events took place in relatively stable climates and ecosystems. 

You'll survive 2 degrees of temperature change over 50-100 years.

And with new technology much damage can be reversed in the next 500 years.

We can blanket the entire planet in trees if we wanted to.

Humans will start terraforming the Earth and controlling its climate.

Fundamentally there is no limit. We are nowhere near tapping out the potential of Earth.

If the evolution of Earth & mankind were a computer progress bar, we'd be stuck at the 1% mark.

item.title: Why does enlightenment have to be so hard to achieve?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
56 minutes ago, electroBeam said:

@Leo Gura The ones that aren't naturally predisposed to be enlightened, but do it anyway because they are badasses, tend to be better at teaching enlightenment to others. 

btw, I don't believe Sadhguru is a natural, he had been meditating/doing yoga since 7 years old. Before that time he was an ordinary person. He seems to really get what people need, and tailors his teachings for it. 

Sadhguru himself says he only reached his current level due to past lives of hardcore practice.

And even if you discount this whole notion of past lives, doing meditation/yoga since 7 years old is extremely hardcore. You say this as if this is something normal. It's not normal at all. This is the equivalent of Tiger Wood or Mozart or Michael Jackson. This is world-class levels of training and talent. This is the kind of training that Olympic athletes go through. And the only reason they can handle it is because they are already super-naturally gifted. Everything has to be aligned.

You are never going to reach Sadhguru's level of mastery. To even think you will is a joke. The only way you'd have a chance is by leaving the internet and living in a cave for the rest of your life, never to be heard from again. And even so, according to Sadhguru's example, you'll need multiple lives to do it.

So there's no time to waste! Go get started right away

item.title: Dr. Sid Smith Lecture explaining why our Civilization is currently in Collapse
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

Just keep in mind that in WWII some 40 million people were killed. During the Black Death, some 1/3rd of Europe was wiped out.

Global warming pales in comparison to those numbers.

Humanity can take a beating and survive. Our species is not fragile. The Earth itself is even less fragile.

Yes, we need bold climate action, but also don't get gloomy.

item.title: Why does enlightenment have to be so hard to achieve?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
8 hours ago, Commodent said:

I'm just curious, how? As in, they wouldn't be able to complete the full 30 days, or that it would have some other unforeseen consequences?

Both

An underprepared person might start to unravel in a dysfunctional way or simply quit spiritualiy altogether, which would be a step backwards. Huge ego backlashes are possible.

1 hour ago, student said:

What do you mean by "talented"? Who are these people? And why are they "talented"? What do you mean by this word? What does it mean to awaken and those people who do so, why are they special?

Can you elaborate on that word?

It's a complex topic with many factors.

Most people who succeed in spirituality have special predispositions for it. This could include: genetics, brain structure and chemistry, mind structure, progress from past lives, super-natural senses and abilities, early childhood conditioning, super-normal concentration ability, etc.

Do not assume that all people start at the same place. Some people are born spiritually attuned and for them awakening takes very little effort because thier brain or mind or state of consciousness is already almost there. This is just not the case for most people. Most people have huge karma to burn off.

And of course such talented people tend to assume awakening is as easy for everyone else as it was for them. But that's like a 7 foot tall basketball player assuming dunking is easy. Of course it is, from his POV.

The crucial mistake here is assuming all people are the same. Not even close. Genetics and the structure of your brain plays a huge role. It's as if some people are naturally high on psychedelics all the time. So of course it's easy then.

item.title: Why does enlightenment have to be so hard to achieve?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@AwakenedSoul444 Frankly, you are not ready for awakening.

Spend a few years doing basic self-help and fixing your life.

item.title: How Leo Brainwashes and the Ultimate Test of His Teachings
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Shaun You're just not understanding this work and having an ego backlash about it.

It's okay, but notice that what you're doing is not coming from a loving and genuine place.

If you disagree with my teachings, that's fine. Just move on. Don't waste your time "exposing", "debunking", etc. This is all ego games and will create bad karma for you.

Trying to ruin people with whom you disagree is a really low move.

As you go deeper in this work your mind will have many backlashes and look for all sorts of distractions to avoid doing the inner work. Yes, this work can make the ego feel depressed or suicidal at times. This is normal for brief periods and not to be indulged. It can be depressing to lose the entire web of meanings which the ego has constructed over a lifetime.

Be careful not to underestimate the depth of the things we talk about here. As I say, this is very advanced stuff. There are many ways the ego-mind can warp and twist these teachings. This work requires great care.

item.title: Why does enlightenment have to be so hard to achieve?

in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

item.title: Is it consciousness really the only source of Healing and arriving to the Truth?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Javfly33 It's not as simplistic as just changing or removing beliefs. Of course beliefs play an important role, but there are many other factors.

Other factors might include but are not limited to:

  • Your state of consciousness
  • New experiences
  • Making new distinctions
  • Diet, exercise, physical body, vitamins, hormonal imbalances
  • New knowledge, insights, & understanding
  • Changing how you interpret things

item.title: Can psychedelics get you to Rainbow body?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

No, psychedelics can give you some amazing glimpses, but they will not do this kind of bodily transformation which takes decades of daily training.

But then again, ordinary meditation and even awakening experiences themselves will also not give you this kind of super-natural degree of bodily transformation.

You're asking for something which extremely few people have ever achieved via whatever methods. The only person who has a chance of achieving this is a full-time monk who has no life other than meditation/yoga. So even talking about such things is almost pointless because no one who is connected to the internet will ever achieve it. If you need guidance on how to achieve it, you will never achieve it.

item.title: Why does enlightenment have to be so hard to achieve?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@AwakenedSoul444 In practice awakening is very hard, which is why so few people do it. And those who do are almost always talented or predisposed to it.

This is one of those truths which nobody in the spiritual community wants to admit.

2 hours ago, AwakenedSoul444 said:

but really I've just been half assing the techniques (because my life circumstances make it hard to have enough willpower and focus).

This is the key problem right here.

To have a realistic chance at awakening your technique needs to be rigorous and you must do it hardcore, at industrial grade levels.

On and off again meditation, even if done for 40 years, will not be enough in most cases. It's very important to do long mediation retreats where you can focus for days at a time without interruption. If this wasn't the case monks and yogis wouldn't be a thing.

The Buddha is a good example of what it takes to seriously awaken. He wasn't dicking around. He renounced his whole life. And that's basically what it takes.

If you want a glimpse of what the Buddha accomplished without renouncing your whole life, psychedelics offer that, just ween off anti-depressants.

I suggest you focus less on awakening right now and more on basic personal development and mental health, so you can be free of anti-depressants. Don't get too ahead of your skiis. There's much value to basic personal development work. That's what most ordinary people need who are not ready to renounce their whole life.

Many books have been written about how to overcome depression. Do your research and get to work.

item.title: Non-human spirituality: Discussion
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

Any sufficiently complex thing should in theory be capable of awakening, assuming its got an ego to begin with.

That's my best guess so far. It's still an iffy area for me.

I don't see why compters cannot one day develop egos. But we are very far from that. Current AI is not even in the right ballpark.

Everything is made of consciousness. Just different configurations of it.

item.title: schizophrenic taking ayahuasca?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

You are better off starting on a different psychedelic like LSD or mushrooms which can be dosed much more accurately.

The key for you is to start with a very low doses and gradually ramp up. You will not be able to do that with Aya because it's never accurately dosed by shamans.

Taking a random dose can certainly cause a freakout. I would consider that reckless in your case.

Accurate dosing of psychedelics is crucial in this work.

1g of mushrooms or 60ug of LSD is a good starting point. Most people should easily handle such a dose.

item.title: Where Is Leo Wrong?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
4 hours ago, Chakra Lion said:

I dont understand that. Is it not Experience that is allowing teachings, awakening, opinion. Experience of Love to know Hate, Hate to know Love. 

Not allowing someone to deny 'truth' of Love and God is dangerous and uncomfortable to say the least, on a public forum.

Personally, that just showed me a reason where Leo is wrong. Where we would all be wrong to not include Haters of Love and God.  

It's nothing personal. It's not like I hate WinterKnight. It's just that I won't allow a teacher to use my platform to teach things I clearly know are mistaken.

It would be like allowing someone to enter a Zen temple and set up shop in the corner, teaching the opposite of Zen. Obviously that would not be tolerated. In such a case, go set up your own school. Then you can teach whatever you want.

No school tolerates all perspectives equally. The whole point is to exclude false teachings. Who gets to decide what is a false teaching? The one who runs the school. How else could it be?

item.title: Why Women Aren't Attracted to Nice Guys
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality

Femininity is attracted to masculinity.

Being nice does not exude masculine essence.

Which is not to say there's anything wrong with being nice. Just don't expect it to make a girl wet.

Women get attracted by boldness, confidence, and assertiveness. And other things, like wit and humor.

item.title: Permanent Awakening After Ayahuasca Retreat
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@erik8lrl Great! You got it!

But also keep in mind that 2 days after a trip is still the honeymoon phase. So don't be surprised if you fall back into duality and ego.

And your work is still not complete. There is much more to become conscious of. This is only the beginning of your development, not the end.

item.title: Is God amazed by himself
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@infinitelove God has no form whatsoever. The only way God can react to itself is through a finite form. These reactions will vary as much as the forms vary.

If you as a human are amazed, that is how God reacts to itself.

If some other human is horrified, that is how God reacts to itself.

If some other human shits his pants, that is how God reacts to itself.

Neither reaction is better or truer than any other. All reactions are relative and partial. Reaction is only possible in the domain of form and duality.

A combination of awe, terror, joy, and confusion is a common human reaction. How a human reacts depends a lot on how pure the human's mind and body are. The bigger one's shadow the more contracted and fearful one's reaction will tend to be.

item.title: Confusion over spiral dynamics
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Nickyy Your view of Green is messed up. You are describing unhealthy Green, not Green proper. And Yellow must build on a foundation of Green. Each stage builds on the previous ones.

item.title: Pick Up = Sexual Harassment?
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality
3 hours ago, Arcangelo said:

So there was a girl at the book section:

Arc -''Hi, what's your name''

She says: -''Scarlet'' And walks away.

I turn around and go get me a cup of coffee, on my way to the cashier 2 security guards approach me and tell me that the girl felt sexually harassed by me and that this is not the first time, that they have been watching me.

Lol

Sounds like you were doing it in a creepy way.

This almost never happens.

If you are camping a small supermarket every day, yeah, you will probably arouse suspicions.

If you want to do lots of approaches you need a large high volume area like a mall or nightclub or sidewalk.

Places like supermarkets require being highly selective. You can't be an approach machine there.

Flirting with a stranger is not sexual harassment. Girls are used to being chatted up. If you do it right, the girl should feel flattered and pleased about herself. It's a huge ego boost for her to be desired. Just don't be creepy. Dress nice, smell nice, groom nice, and SMILE for fuck's sake. Do not approach girls without a big cheeky smile.

item.title: Why there is no beginning without an end?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@Name Take a piece of paper and slowly draw a big circle on it. Notice that as you draw the inside you simultaneously draw the outside. You cannot only draw the inside.

That is how all dualities work. You cannot have an up without its opposite, you cannot have a beginning without its opposite.

A division always creates two pieces. And what you're doing is dividing reality with your mind.

Once you have your first psychedelic breakthrough, you will realize what a fool you've been pursing Yellow. Turquoise is where life begins. Everything else is like living like a dog.

I would recommend that you have a psychedelic breakthrough by whatever means possible as soon as possible. Otherwise you just can't understand what you are missing. But of course responsibility for that is all on you. I cannot tell you want to do.

item.title: Death is real whether you like it or not.
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
8 minutes ago, The Don said:

Okay, @Leo Gura.

Let's say there is no death.

But how about God? Or consciousness.

What if the consciousness itself is a tragedy? What if the eternity of consciousness is not a good thing?

What if God itself or consciousness as you call it, is in a state of major depression? Or in a state of deep suffering.

What if consciousness itself cannot handle itself?

How can something like God or the consciousness itself can be something good?

What if consciousness itself has no purpose? And how come that consciousness itself is a possibility?

Why does consciousness itself has to exist?

All of your questions are misguided.

You are lacking awakening. So you keep speaking untruthful things.

item.title: If I see some traits of Feminism as a threat or unfair is because I´m biased?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

@Javfly33 By your logic, why should you ever care about anyone but yourself?

In your self-centeredness you interpret the message of "stop violence against women" as somehow taking resources away from men. Yet this message doesn't mean to ignore men's issues.

You lack basic empathy for those who are not you.

You are like a white guy in the colonial South who walks by a poster that says, "Stop slavery now!" and you say to yourself, "But why should I care about the slaves when white poor folk are hungry on the streets? How is helping slaves fair?"

Stop thinking that helping to elevate others somehow takes away from you. This is a scarcity mindset.

By caring about women, you will increase your care for men. By helping animals you will also help the whole universe. << this is the proper attitude. Love is an unlimited resource, so you don't have to worry about holding it back.

item.title: Meditation Bordem
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
49 minutes ago, Red-White-Light said:

Does anyone have any advice for meditation?

I literally can't meditate for more than 10 minutes, it drives me insane.

Even on the train or waiting it's very difficult.

That's how it is. Takes a lot of practice to overcome that. Usually years of rigorous practice are required.

This problem of boredom is existential. It goes very deep. It can't be avoided. The point of meditation is to face it directly, which creates suffering -- which is why hardly anyone meditates.

Meditation is supposed to be so boring it kills you.

item.title: I want to show people the limitations of science, but there is a problem
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
On 11/15/2019 at 0:18 PM, Consilience said:

Yet this is the tragedy of your situation: While you may be a world class scientist, and you understand all the physical, chemical, and biological mechanisms of red, you’re color blind and can only see on a greyscale. See, despite all of you’re intellectualizing and scientific investigation of this specific light phenomena, you’ve still missed a crucial component to what red *is* existentially. You’ve missed an experiential insight into what red is that no amount of science can help you with.

That's a classic example from philosophy of mind / phenomenology. Unfortunately even when you give that example, people still ignore it. Materialism simply discounts all phenomena as "subjective" and therefore insignificant.

A materialist scientist will simply not understand how seeing the color red has any importance to science. "Okay, so even if I miss the color red, so what? Doesn't change a thing."

item.title: Bernie Sanders rally
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

@Bno Trying to win over Trump voters is overrated. It's more important to mobilize the progressive base.

Of course Bernie and Yang have some cross-over, which is nice.

But Biden does well against Trump in polls.

Warren would probably have the hardest time. But then again, caring about what Trump voters think/want is not a top priority. They had their chance, they fucked it up, and they show little remorse.

If Trump voters admitted their error, then maybe we could have more sympathy for them. But as long as they act like assholes and keep denying any wrongdoing, no deal. There need to be consequences for electing terrible leaders. You don't get to elect a terrible leader and then come back the next time and make demands about how you're not getting enough of what you want, expecting everyone cater to your priorities.

Catering to Trump voters is not necessary to defeat Trump.

item.title: Would a turquoise be able to run for US president?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
8 hours ago, Nickyy said:

@Leo Gura I don't think Bernie is green, his outlook is yellow. I just watched a quick clip of him speaking on Joe Rogan about adopting Canadian healthcare etc and he's not really demonizing big industry, but merely pointing out the pathological bits of capitalism that are proving themselves to be a problem for the whole system.

Green is not really like that, green would dish out everything equally because it demonizes any form of hierarchy altogether.

I simply consider that healthy Green.

Be careful holding demonization as a defining feature of Green. That's pathological Green.

Of course Bernie has some elements of Yellow in him. It's hard to tell what the exact percentages are without knowing him more personally.

To me he is the poster-boy of solid healthy Green.

item.title: Fruit flies and pedophiles
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
36 minutes ago, FuriousGeorge said:

I’m curious how you would reframe an issue like this Leo, if you were/are me, and your 4 year old told you something so heinous?

Love and forgiveness is the solution in such a case.

What such a "test" is testing you for, is the breadth and depth of your love.

If you fail the "test", that's okay too. You'll just suffer more.

The cure to all forms of abuse is deeper self-love, both for the parent, the child, and the abuser.

It's very counter-intuitive because when your survival is deeply threatened the last thing you want to do is love. It takes great wisdom, bravery, heart, and consciousness to be able to love in such situations. And therein lies the "test". Such situations reveal your true level of development. Highly developed beings are capable of embracing it with love. But of course this is rare among humans. We are a crude species.

Deeper self-love is the cure to all trauma and injustice.

item.title: People living in hell - Why cant they start-over? (suicide)
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
9 hours ago, WHO IS said:

Leo, therefore I ponder why make a big deal out of destroying something which is imaginary/the body, whereas your Mind which is real Youll have with you for eternity?

Firstly, I don't make a big deal about it. I'm just pointing out hidden consequences which you may not have considered to this action.

Consciousness is more complex than just mind/body. There seem to be structures which persist between lifetimes. Suicide could affect those structures.

Quote

It's not like the only way to exist is by being attached to an animal host, in our case it is being the homo-sapien bodies. It is like people have no confidence in their being and they rely upon an animal-host to exist, no matter how much pain/suffering this animal host gives to the Mind. Especially when your Mind advanced enough to not be "content" with whatever pleasures the animal host can provide, be it sexual, food, any other forms of carnal entertainment.

In the ultimate sense, everything leads back to total oneness, so there is no problem. But it seems to take consciousness many incarnations to get there. I'm not saying suicide will damn you forever to hell. I'm saying it could be temporary set-back, slowing the overall process. There is nothing wrong with slowing the process, per se. It's all relative.

9 hours ago, Anton Rogachevski said:

@Leo Gura

Is it true to say that if many have committed suicide, it was indeed god's plan? How can anything go against god's will? If he gave us free choice, why should any choice be wrong?

By definition everything that happens is "God's plan". But not in the simplistic sense of everything being predetermined. God's plan is a meta plan which includes your human plans. You have the freedom to make your human plans.

No choice is right or wrong. Any choice you make is fine from God's POV. God has no desire to manipulate you and no particular desired outcome.

Quote

If death is imaginary, is suicide also imaginary?

It's imaginary in the same way a brick wall is imaginary.

The notion of "imaginary" is much more robust than most people think. It encompasses all of "physical reality". So just saying that something is imaginary doesn't automatically set you free of it.

Quote

Isn't it arrogant to assume that that we can affect the way of nature with our actions?

Nope. Humans clearly affect nature with our actions. Even if you decide to take no action, that will have an affect on nature. It is impossible to not take action. Even inaction is a kind of action.

item.title: How to have Sociopathic levels of detachment with girls and dating
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality
1 hour ago, Serotoninluv said:

This is an exercise I do in one of my classes: I go to the chalkboard and tell the class I will ask them a question and I want them to call out ideas.  I then say “First I’ll ask the males in the class ‘Tell me all the actions you take on a daily basis to protect yourself from sexual harassment and sexual assault”. . . Silence. . . The guys look confused. . . They don’t know if this is a trick question. . . Sometimes I tease them and say “C’mon guys, don’t be shy - let it out”. Nothing. . . . Then I ask the woman the same question and they give rapid fire answers. I’m now writing as fast as I can on the board and can’t keep up with them.

Haha, brilliant!

item.title: A Definition of Love
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality
4 hours ago, Astra said:

The definition is 

Love is recognizing perfection and then communicating that perfection to a being using action or inaction

That's warm but doesn't hit the nail on the head.

Your definition is not fundamental enough. It still requires activity like "recognizing" and "communicating", which is 2nd order stuff.

1st order Love requires no action. 1st order Love is simply Being itself.

The best way to think of it is like this: replace your notion that everything is made out of atoms to "everything is made out of love". Love is the very substance of physical reality.

An exercise I like to do is to look at my hand and just remind myself that it's made out of Love. This reconnects me with Love, reminding me that it's more fundamental than an activity.

Yes, what that video calls the 10th dimemsion is the Absolute. It is everything possible, and nothing.

item.title: Rate Your Current Happiness
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

As soon as you start rating happiness, you'll lose it.

The proper answer is: who gives a fuck? Reality is whatever it is and you feel however you feel at any given moment. Don't confuse true happiness with mood. That can be a serious error.

Trying to "lock in" a happy mood is very counter-productive. You are guaranteed to fail at that.

If you want real happiness, stop caring whether you're dying or being tortured. Then you'll be happy. And nothing less than that will hold up.

item.title: People living in hell - Why cant they start-over? (suicide)
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
11 minutes ago, Nirvanalight said:

Could you explain why exactly? Karmic debt is something that most religions use as a weapon of fear mongering to keep people in control. I myself do not believe in such a thing. It would also mean that we do have free will as human beings, which I also serious doubt. But, I' am open to new suggestion. 

Karma is much more than fear mongering.

This topic is too complex and advanced to discuss on a forum. You'd need decades of advanced spiritual practice to begin to understand such things and I'm nowhere near understanding all that.

If you violently disrupt consciousness (via suicide), it's not unreasonable to expect a ripple effect which cascades from such an event, disrupting the evolution of consciousness. Don't think of it as a punishment, think of it as a natural consequence of self-rejection and self-hatred. How can consciousness continue its evolution if it hates itself so much it cannot even finish out one human life?

item.title: Would a turquoise be able to run for US president?
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
1 hour ago, Nickyy said:

There has already been a yellow leader. Obama was yellow

That's a bit questionable. I'm not certain how much of Obama was Yellow or Orange/Green. It's hard to tell without knowing him more deeply.

Keep in mind, the higher a person is up the Spiral the harder he is to assess accurately because there is more uniqueness of expression at Tier 2.

Bernie is definitely more progressive than Obama, so I see Bernie as a step up for American politics. He is certainly less acceptable to the mainstream than Obama. America has yet to elect a solid, powerful Green leader. Few people embody solid Green. It's one thing to dabble in Green, it's another thing to really master it as Bernie has.

For America to elect a solid Green leader would be a massive step forward. And it would cause a serious backlash as well. Bernie will not be well tolerated by many people even if he is elected. Turbulent times are ahead as America is forced to go Green kicking and screaming. We need to solidify in Green before we start worrying too much about Yellow. Green is good enough for now.

item.title: What is your perspective on RASA
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

@LfcCharlie4 I rejected RASA so that I could prove out the psychedelic path without conflicting influences.

I don't rank consciousness on any linear scale because I feel that would be misleading.

Keep in mind that just because a book is on my book list doesn't mean I agree with it 100%. If that was my standard the book list would be empty. I expect you to read books and evaluate them using careful and nuanced discernment. No book can be trusted or followed blindly.

Keep in mind that spiritual paths can be very unique. Don't try to follow anyone else's way. Make your own way -- whatever that entails. My way entailed psychedelics and I don't regret it.

item.title: People living in hell - Why cant they start-over? (suicide)
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality

It happens all the time. Tens of thousands of times per year.

But don't assume the "respawn" is free and clear. There is very likely an enormous karmic debt that comes with suicide. So avoid it if you can.

item.title: Does psychedelic give you access to different dimensions?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

It's more radical than that. That's just the tip of what Infinity is.

They give you access to God. No word or video can do justice to what God is.

item.title: What is your perspective on RASA
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
51 minutes ago, LfcCharlie4 said:

saying it isn’t viable or has no use and is apparently a dick mesasuring contest.

No, it has it's value. We just need to be conscious of its limits.

If it had no value I wouldn't have it on my book list.

Try to be more nuanced in your thinking. Things aren't good or bad, valuable or valueless. It's all in the details.

Tools of the mind need to be used properly to avoid traps and errors.
